page.title: 03TWINEHAM C.E. SCHOOL
page.content: Twineham School is Church of England Controlled, and serves a small rural area bounded by Wineham Lane to the West, the B2116 road to the South, Goddard's Green to the East and Twineham Court Farm to the North. At the start of the summer term 1985 the staff consisted of Head Teacher(male) 2 Assistant Teachers(female) and 2 Partime Teachers(female_3/10),1 Clerical Assistant(female) 1 Caretaker (female) 1 Ancillary Assistant(female_ partime) 2 Servery Assistants who serve school meals sent from the kitchens at Albourne School.The school roll is 62, and there are 3 classes Infants, and Lower and Upper Juniors at the present time 54% of the school are Infants under 7. The children come from a wide area outside of that officially designated and most come from priviledged homes.
